title: sackets harbor ambulance fund
Description: Sackets Harbor Fire Company Ambulance squad provides free emergency service care to the residents of Sackets Harbor, Town of Hounsfield and surrounding areas. We are comprised of hard working volunteers that always ensure our residents are safe. Read more

title: SCAR new rescue van
Description: Thank you for visiting Sean Casey Animal Rescue's fundraising page to purchase a new rescue van. Our current van, a 2005 GMC, has enabled us to rescue thousands of animals for well over a decade racking up almost half a million miles! It's a crucial part of our operations. From routine spay/neuter surgeries to life-saving critical care and through crisis response during trying times like Hurricane Sandy and the Covid pandemic this van was a lifeline!We’ve done our best to keep it going with routine maintenance like tune-ups and oil changes and general repairs but age is catching up with it. Repairing the heating and air conditioning systems has become routine. These repairs are costly and are draining our budget. The built-in cages are also in rough shape from daily use and cleaning over the years. Please help us reach our goal of $60,000 to purchase a new rescue transport van, no donation is too small, every donation makes a difference. Please share and help spread the word! Thank you for your continued support!SEAN CASEY ANIMAL RESCUE IS A 501(c)(3) NON-PROFIT, NO-KILL SHELTER specializing in the rescue, rehabilitation and placement of dogs, cats, reptiles, birds and small mammals. Our rescue takes in over 2,000 animals per year, the most of any other private rescue in New York. We are one of very few rescues who take in the most difficult medical cases. We do it because they need life-saving medical care and they have nowhere else to go. Everyone deserves a second chance and our most vulnerable animals need us the most.*Proudly Serving New York City’s Homeless Animals since 1998*153 East 3rd Street, Brooklyn, NY 11218www.nyanimalrescue.orgRead more

title: jamies marathon for the good grief trust
Description: Hi, my name's Jamie, and just over two years ago I tragically lost my best friend, Josh, in an accident in Budapest. Since then, I have struggled to come to terms with my grief as this was such a shocking and sudden loss that nothing could prepare me for it.For those who were lucky to have met Josh, you would know he was the kindest, funniest, and most outrageously stubborn person to grace this earth. He never pretended to be anything he wasn't and therefore had a true sense of character, which he projected onto his friends and family. The care and love he showed to us was immeasurable and always pushed us to achieve the best we could in life. Whether it was music, tennis, cycling, cooking, or drinking, he pushed himself to be the best of his ability, and he always encouraged you to do the same in your life. The warmth and energy he brought to the room will never be matched and there will always be an empty chair in the corner of my eye where he should be sat.Grief can leave you feeling so isolated, like your fighting this battle all alone, and you forget that the simplest solution is to reach out for help. I wish that earlier I had decided to use the services of charities such as The Good Grief Trust because their cause is so important in reminding the hundreds of thousands of us who suffer from grief every day that they are not alone. Bereavement support is out there, and it's paramount that those who need it, like myself, have access to it to avoid further suffering. The Good Grief Trust can provide that. For this reason, I have decided that I will run the Edinburgh Marathon on the 29th of May to raise money for their cause, and most importantly to celebrate the memory of my best friend. I never dreamed that I would run a marathon, but I know Josh would have pushed me towards fulfilling my dream and I know he'll be running every step of the way alongside me on the day.Any donation you can make would be greatly appreciated! :)Read more

title: nesya wedding
Description: All that know Nastya can agree that she is a beautiful soul and amazing girl both inside and out!  BH she is getting married in just a few weeks! Mazal tov! We are so happy for her!! Nastya is an orphan; sadly her mother passed away 2 years ago during childbirth and since then Nastya’s been raising her baby sister and young siblings, teaching them true wholesome Torah values and providing all their needs. Although life has not been easy for her, you would never know it, because she never complains! Today you can make all the difference- yes you! How would you like to join in this quick 24 hour challenge?  You can make a difference in the life of our dear wonderful sister living in Odessa Ukraine! We together have so much power- every small donation will add up to something big- giving her the wedding of her dreams and helping her get on her feet and start a Jewish home of her own. Let’s challenge ourselves to raise $20,000 in the next 24 hours! Think we can get there? Well… it’s up to each and every one of you! Please open your heart and take action now! And in the merit of taking care of one of Hashems children may Hashem take care of you, his child and shower you with all the blessings! Amen!Read more

title: taylors fundraiser for end overdose
Description: Hi. My name is Taylor Wood and I’m turning 25 this weekend on January 16th. For my birthday this year, I want to celebrate by raising money for a nonprofit called End Overdose. End Overdose is dedicated to ending the fight against fentanyl and overdose prevention. This cause is extremely close to my heart. This past year we lost our best friend, Kevin Fisher, to fentanyl poisoning and accidental overdose. Kevin was a once in a lifetime friend. Losing him shattered so many hearts and life will never be the same without him. I know that everyone who knew and loved Kevin is struggling as much as I am.This unfortunately goes beyond Kevin. I know almost everyone right now has lost someone due to fentanyl poisoning or overdose. Fentanyl is killing our friends, brothers, sisters, and loved ones. Too many people have lost their lives to this. Deaths from fentanyl and overdose can be prevented if we all help together. No donation amount is too small and everything is deeply appreciated. Please join me in this fight to help protect the people we love. Let’s stop watching this epidemic unfold from the sidelines and come together to be the change.More information about End Overdose Incorporated: End Overdose is a 501c3 nonprofit committed to preventing drug-related death as a result of overdose through naloxone training in person and online. We provide fentanyl test kits as well. End Overdose gives health equity to all persons in need, our services are completely free. We raise public awareness, connecting communities with the necessary resources to fight chemical dependency and drug overdose death. United, we can End Overdose.Read more

title: rebuilding catnip acres clinic
Description: Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit Catnip Acres Inc, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.This morning at 5:20 am I got the dreaded phone call. The entire clinic burned down. All medications: gone. Equipment: gone. Traps: gone. We lost everything. Luckily, the only silver lining in this, no pets were inside at the time of the fire (thank god!!).We have had obstacles before…but none like this. We are devastated and in shock. Carol has spent the last 35 years caring for the cats and dogs in Greene County. She has spayed/neutered over 50,000 cats and has found well over 50,000 cats homes. Carol does so much for this community and now we need more help than ever before to get our spay/neuter clinics, our TNR program, and our surgery clinics back up and running. We won’t give up this fight! Animals are our whole life and to watch every asset that helps us facilitate those animals burn up is heart wrenching.Please help us continue to help the animals in our community. We always have so much support from everyone, and we cannot thank you enough for any and all help.Read more

title: open up the SMN art gallery
Description: The student art gallery at Shawnee Mission North (SMN) High School, the Brantman Art Gallery, is 42 years old and showing its age. The lighting is poor and the wall materials are deteriorating. Most importantly, with a closed-off entrance to the Gallery, students are unable to see the art when they walk by. In fact, some SMN students don't even know there's a gallery in the school. We want to change that!We are grateful to the Shawnee Mission School District and a local contractor for donating their services to fix the interior needs. But to create a modern Gallery for SMN students, we want to OPEN UP the gallery with a glass entry wall so everyone can see the art! The district cannot cover the cost of the new glass wall and with the interior updates starting over Spring Break, we only have until February 28th to raise $12,000 to bring a fresh, new look to the Gallery. Every dollar donated will go directly to the purchase of this glass wall and donors will be recognized on a plaque near the Art Gallery.With the 100th year anniversary of Shawnee Mission North this year, please make a donation TODAY to ensure the North community has an art gallery they can be proud of!——About the GalleryFor the students and teachers of Shawnee Mission North High School, the Brantman Art Gallery has been a staple of the art department for over 40 years. Serving both students and the broader community, the Gallery provides a space for students and community artists to present their work in a proper environment.It provides for North’s art students what gymnasiums and theaters offer for other students.The first of its kind, the Gallery opened in 1980 with overwhelming support from the community.The Patrons Art Gallery, Inc, a 501(c)(3) organization, was formed with a Board of Directors to support the programming and fundraising needs of the space. The Board, comprised of community volunteers and North teachers, has continued to support the Gallery through the years.The Board has engaged many professional artists who have shown at the gallery and worked alongside students in their classrooms.In addition to regular exhibits, the gallery has purchased over 50 pieces of art from students to form a permanent collection.To support the art department, the Gallery has funded scholarships for over 30 North students to attend summer art enrichment classes at the KC Art Institute. Annually, the Gallery funds opportunities for students to visit the Nelson-Atkins Art Museum exhibits—some students attending a museum for the first time.The Board is proud to continue providing enrichment opportunities and support for the artistic growth of Shawnee Mission North art students.Read more

title: draw together classrooms
Description: DrawTogether is an interactive art-making show and creative learning universe for kids and families, hosted by New York Times’ first weekly visual columnist and #1 bestselling illustrator Wendy MacNaughton.The show first launched in 2020 over Instagram Live as a response to the COVID-19 pandemic, when schools were closed and kids were stuck at home. As tens of thousands of kids around the world started logging in to watch Wendy’s classes on Instagram Live, Wendy realized she was tapping into something bigger. The show was resonating because it was helping kids learn how to process emotions, explore new topics and think creatively.In fall 2021, DrawTogether Classrooms launched -- a program to provide comprehensive Social Emotional Learning-based art programming at low or no cost to schools, districts, and community-based organizations. To grow DrawTogether Classrooms, we need to be able to provide access to the tools and materials for making art. This is where you come in! With your support, we aim to deliver thousands of DrawTogether Art Kits to students all across the country.WHY THIS MATTERS:Art education has been stripped from schools. Yet studies show (and parents know) that art is crucial for developing creative thinking, academic success, and emotional well-being — all of which are central to the 21st-century skills experts identify as necessary for young people to grow and succeed in today’s world. At a glance:- When children regularly participate in art-making in a safe, supportive, and structured environment, they gain communication and comprehension skills that support learning across the subject spectrum.- When that environment is grounded in growth mindset and research on neurodiversity, as DrawTogether is, young people from all backgrounds feel heard, seen, and encouraged to take creative risks.- And when technology facilitates these practices, DrawTogether helps to bridge the digital divide: it becomes a critical access point through which young students can have positive experiences online, develop digital literacy skills, and set themselves up for successful online learning.BUDGET and ART KIT INFO:Each DrawTogether Art Kit costs $35, which includes the supplies, box, and fulfillment/mailing. To start, we are raising money for 2000 kits which will cost $70,000. Your support will change the lives of thousands of students in need!DrawTogether Art Kits will be beautifully custom-designed boxes containing high-quality supplies kids need for drawing and creating - paper, pencils, watercolors, oil pastels (which studies show are better than crayons for emotional processing) and more! We believe the kit will make a huge difference in how kids feel about making art - and moreover, themselves. AND we want to prove it. So in addition to providing these supplies as part of our DrawTogether Classrooms pilot, we are going to collect data to learn more about how art materials impact students' creativity and sense of self. Please donate, share, and follow along with our DrawTogether Classrooms journey!All donations are directed to Intersection for the Arts designated U.S. 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization and are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. Each donor will receive a tax-deductible receipt via email upon donating.Read more

title: anil karki medical treatment
Description: कास्की जिल्ला साबिक घाचोक गा।बि।स।हाल माछापुच्छ«े गाउँपालिका स्थायी घर भई पोखरा महानगरपालिका बसोबास गर्ने हाल भर्जिनिया निवासी  नेपाल कानुन तथा लेखापढी व्यबशायी समितिका निबर्तमान अध्यक्ष,समाज सेवी व्यक्तित्व हाम्रा आदरणी दाजु अनिल कार्की ९अम्बर० लामो समय देखी बिश्वको दुर्लभ,९बिश्व प्रसिद्ध बैज्ञानिक स्टेफन हाकिङ्ग० लाई लागेको९ए।एल।एस।० रोग बाट ग्रस्त भई नेपाल तथा भारत का बिभिन्न अस्पतालहरुमा उपचार गराउदा समेत निको नभएको र सो रोगको अमेरीका को फ्लोरिडा स्थित मायो क्लिनकमा मात्र उपचार हुने भएकोले साथै निजहरुले नेपाल तथा भारतको विभिन्न अस्पतालहरुमा उपचार गराउँदा निकै ठुलो धनराशीको खर्च भएकाले उहाँको जिबनरक्षाको लागी अमेरीका तथा बिश्व भरी रहेका सम्पुर्ण नेपाली हरुको संस्था गैर आवाशीय नेपाली संघ,जनसम्पर्क समिति, प्रबाशी मञ्च,पत्रकार महासंघ,कास्की समाज तथा बिभिन्न समाजिक संघ संस्था मार्फत सम्पुर्ण नेपालीहरुले आफुले सक्दो सहयोग गरी जिबनरक्षा गर्दिनहुनका लागी  बिनम्र अनुरोध गर्दछौ । भबदिय श्रीराम वाग्ले जर्जिया एटलान्टा सम्पर्क १ [phone redacted] बिरामी अम्बर बहादुर कार्की उहाँ की श्रीमती शुष्मा कार्की  सम्पर्क १ [phone redacted]सहयोगी दिपक थापा         सम्पर्क १ [phone redacted] बसन्त कार्की माउन्ट एभरेष्ट टेलिभिजन क्यानाडा १ [phone redacted]Kul Gurung  [phone redacted]Ramesh Shrestha  [phone redacted]Read more

title: k9 grass for the lighthouse animal shelter dogs
Description: Having a happy environment for our adoptable animals that is also healthy is one of our top priorities. We've looked into other options but having artificial grass for our play yard is the one that makes the most sense for our dogs, volunteers, and visitors.Our new lawn will be installed by Forever Lawn. https://www.foreverlawn.com/k9grass/Clean, safe, better-smelling environmentAntimicrobial protectionEasy to maintainYears ago we had natural grass at our shelter! With thousands of happy dogs running in circles, that quickly turned into sand. With our New England weather, that sand quickly turns into mud. With heavy rain, the giant mud puddle at one end of our yard lingers for days. While our dogs do love playing and digging in the dirt & mud, K9 Grass/Turf will provide them with a clean, safe, and comfortable surface to play and relax on.What our dogs will soon find out is that if we spend less time cleaning our floors, kennels, etc. of dust and dirt and less time cleaning each dog as they come in after a party in the mud puddle, we'll have more time to dote on our pups on our new K9 Grass lawn!The quote for our backyard is $31,750. This is going to be a huge hit on our finances but it's one that we truly believe is the right choice for our current dogs and the hundreds of dogs we rescue from euthanasia in the future.This is something we have contemplated doing for years and we're finally taking the plunge with the health and happiness of our dogs in mind. Please consider helping us provide our dogs with a better outdoor experience.You can make a difference by donating today to Lighthouse Animal Shelter.We are an all-volunteer, 501 (c) 3 organization whose leadership brings decades of combined experience in animal welfare and rescue. Lighthouse Animal Shelter focuses its efforts on helping homeless animals. All animals in our care receive full vetting: spay/neuter, vaccines, testing & parasite control. We offer information and referral services to assist the community with concerns relating to their own or stray companion animals.Read more

title: double enucleation for dexter the little kitten
Description: Our baby Dexter was rescued during the holidays. We found our sweet boy all alone, wandering the cold streets in dire need of medical attention. His eyes were undoubtedly a huge concern, but we had to remain focused on stabilizing him and tending to his most immediate needs. In the back of our minds, we knew he'd likely need both eyes removed. Fast forward a few weeks, the kitten is finally strong enough to endure what we ultimately knew would be his fate, a double-eye enucleation. We had never given up hope that maybe we could save one eye, but time has made the decision for us. The only way for Dexter to have a fulfilling life is to proceed with the surgery. But his big hurdle is his mounting medical bills. Dexter is a fighter, but he doesn't have a job and can't provide for himself, so we are asking everyone to help donate to Dexter's medical fund today. Absolutely any amount is appreciated! Take today to be Dexter's shoulder to lean on. Read more

title: emergency blood transfusion for puppy
Description: Urgent Emergency Blood Transfusion Needed!It’s been a very long sad day here. This is one of Reese’s pups who is fighting for her life at this very moment. This group was rescue from a kill shelter in Georgia after Momma Reese required a c-section at an emergency vet in Ga. We got through that and all puppies made it out alive. They were thriving but this past week this puppy fell ill. It appears she is severely anemic and the only way to save her is with blood. It is very costly and she is awaiting her transfusion at an emergency vet in our area. Her fecal was negative so we know it’s not a parasite but before we can move forward we need her stable with a transfusion. We can’t give up on her now so we’re reaching out for help. This little girl is a fighter and with the right care we know she will pull through. She is in great hands with around the clock care but we have to present a deposit to move forward. Please share far and wide so we can save this sweet little baby. We have included the estimate and her bloodwork below. We have several donation options but we need to network fast to save her. Venmo: @all4thedogsrescue Our PayPal is our email address. We also have a donate button on our website: Www.All4thedogsrescue.comMore information about All 4 The Dogs Rescue: All 4 the Dogs Rescue is a non-profit 501(c)(3) all breed dog rescue organization. We specialize in pregnant mother dogs, mothers with litters and puppies. All of our rescue dogs are in approved foster homes until adopted by an approved loving family. Our goal is to rescue, rehab and place dogs that are abandoned, unwanted, or abused. We strive to improve the animals quality of life, and to alleviate the overpopulation of dogs throughout the world.All 4 The Dogs RescueRead more

title: te shpetojme jeten e ajanit nga kosova
Description: Të dashur vëllezër dhe motraJeta e përditshme e atyre me më pak fat se ne është një luftë që është e vështirë të kuptohet nga shume prej nesh. Imagjinoni ndjenjën e deshpermimit të një familjeje pa çati mbi kokë, apo të dikujt që nuk mund të sigurojë ushqim, veshje apo nevoja mjekësore për veten dhe fëmijët e tij. Fatkeqësisht, këto janë shqetësime reale në jetën e shumë bashkatdhetarëve tane shqiptarë për shkak të rrethanave jashtë kontrollit të tyre. Askush nuk dëshiron të jetë në atë pozitë, por fatkeqësisht shumë janë. Misioni ynë është i qarte, tu shërbejme dhe tu ndihmojme sa me shumë vëllezërve dhe motrave tona në nevojë, por misioni ynë nuk do të ishte i mundur pa mbështetjen tuaj. Ju jeni ata qe mund të siguroni një të ardhme të ndritur për jetimët, shpresë për të pafuqishmit e lehtësim për të sëmurët."Permireso një jetë, ndrysho një botë" kjo është filozofia jonë. Vizioni ynë është të fuqizojmë njerëzit dhe t'i aftësojmë ata që të ndihmojnë veten dhe komunitetet e tyre. Le të bashkohemi së bashku e t'i kthejmë lotët e dëshpërimit në lot gëzimi. Ne besojme fort që çdo moment eshte i rëndësishem, sepse cdo dite ka jetë qe ndalojne në pritje te një dore ndihmë.Faleminderit dhe Zoti ju bekoftë ju dhe familjet tuaja!Dear Brothers and SistersThe day-to-day living of those less fortunate than us is a struggle that is hard to imagine in our modernized activities. Imagine the feeling of hopelessness of a family without a roof on their head, or someone unable to provide food, clothing, and medical needs for himself and his kids.Unfortunately, these are real concerns in the lives of many fellow Albanians due to circumstances outside of their control. No one wants to be in that position, but unfortunately many are. Our mission is to serve and help our brothers and sisters in need, but our mission would not be possible without your support. You can ensure a bright future for the orphans, offer hope for the helpless, and provide relief for the sick."Brighten a life, change a world" is our philosophy. Our vision is to empower people and enable them to help themselves and their communities. Let’s get together and turn tears of desperation into tears of joy. We are strong believers that every moment counts because lives are on hold for every day that goes by without a helping hand.Thank you and may God Bless you and your families!Read more

title: quest for land
Description: It's time to address Huntsville's homelessness differently.Huntsville has a gap, we are lacking in housing that is supportive, permanent, and affordable.That is why we are unable to effectively deal with homelessness.Together, we are better! Help build a residential community to END chronic homelessness in Huntsville.IT'S TIME FOR PERMANENT CHANGE!We are going to build a residential community where the chronically homeless can find a job within our Restoration Works program and pay for an affordable home while receiving the help that they need to regain their lives.STEP 1: Raise Money to BUY LAND & build a residential community for our chronic homeless neighbors.*Join us on the quest for land. We are raising funds (Goal - $1.5 Million) to purchase 50 acres of land in Madison County for a mixed-use residential community development.*Community of Hope strongly believes that homelessness is a community issue and through community we can solve it. Our Vision - Solving chronic homelessness through community.Our Mission - To build a permanent, supportive residential community for our chronically homeless neighbors and empower our surrounding community into a lifestyle of love and service.Click here to take action now TAKE ACTION NOW To learn more: Learn more about our organization by visiting our newly developed website below.Community of Hope - Website If you would like to schedule an in-person meeting for your team or organization, please email us at SCHEDULE IN-PERSON MEETING. We would love to share the goodness that awaits our homeless community right here in Huntsville, AL.Follow us on social media! @HSVCOHINSTAGRAM FACEBOOK TWITTER More information about Huntsville Community of Hope:Community of Hope (COH), founded in 2019, is a master-crafted residential community providing affordable, permanent housing through tiny homes. We will provide a supportive community for men and women coming out of chronic homelessness. Community of Hope is paving the way for the largest collaborative effort our city has ever seen in mitigating homelessness right here in The Rocket City. Our master-crafted community will provide tiny homes, places of employment for our friends coming out of chronic homelessness, access to care for physical and mental health, a community general store, animal husbandry, gardens, orchards, and so much more.Community of Hope (COH) is in the business of providing systemic change creating a sustainable impact in all areas of our community. Community of Hope is looking to purchase 50 acres of land in Madison County and will be a mixed use development. Our economic development effort highlights are listed below:• Creating New Jobs• Affordable Single Dwelling Residential Units• Shopping• Dining• Recreational Opportunities• Housing Existing Non-Profits and Organizations on-site• Restoration Works Program• Educational Programs• Volunteer Opportunities• Gardening Program• Community Forge• Wood-shop• Art House• Concessions• Mobile Vending• Food Trucks• Community Inn (Airbnb)• Animal HusbandryRead more

title: in memoriam dons brain cancer fundraiser
Description: Exactly a year and three days ago, as my beloved grandfather was in his final hours of life, I sat down at the piano and I wrote a song.His caregiver, Sophie, played it for him when he was too weak to sit up or speak. She placed his phone on his chest and played it over and over until she knew all the lyrics too. She said he laced his hands over the phone and held it to himself. I’d like to think it was my final gift to him to see him off. And now, a year after his death, I’m sharing it in the hope that it can be a gift for the many others who are battling brain cancer.If you give the song a listen, please consider donating however much you can. All funds will go to the National Brain Tumor Society, an organization that is fighting tirelessly to make headway in drug advancements, research, and public policy changes for brain tumor patients.Thank you so much to Steve Perski for donating his time, studio, and talent out of the kindness of his heart. I’m so grateful to have a professional mix of a song that once lived only in my iPhone and on my grandpa’s chest.I hope we one day live in a world where no one has to lose someone the way I lost my grandfather. And I hope this is a small step toward making that a reality.With love,SarahRead more

title: year end
Description: Dear Fellow Animal Lover,   As 2021 comes to a close, we reflect once again on what a complicated two years it has been for us. We, like so many others, have faced staffing shortages that hampered transport, adoptions, intake from the public, and transfers from our municipal shelters. Veterinarian shortages have stalled critical spay/neuter procedures resulting in person after person requesting help for litter after unwanted litter making it impossible for us to help everyone who calls.   Because of staff shortages we were forced to re-evaluate and steam-line our protocols which has not been an entirely bad thing. We faced many challenges during this period, all senior staff stepping up and pitching in to do everything needed to keep the organization moving forward. We have all learned a lot and evolved during this difficult time. We continue to search for new and creative ways to face a plethora of post-pandemic challenges!   We want to thank everyone who continued to support us these last two years. Volunteers are slowly returning, and the animals are thrilled to see all the new faces. The staff has missed the help and are grateful to see it return.   Because of staff shortages the number of intakes has dropped but we hope that with your support we can increase intakes back to pre-pandemic numbers. Only with your help, will we be able to get these homeless and abandoned pets out of harm’s way and into our care where they will be treated with kindness and compassion until they are ready to be adopted or transported up north where they will be adopted within days of arrival.   Our audit shows more than 82% of the Mobile SPCA’s funding comes from the generosity of heroes like you from your donations and bequests. We keep administrative costs to a minimum which allows us to spend 82 cents of every dollar on the animals in our care!   While transporting animals is a wonderful band-aid, we work tirelessly to stop the overpopulation at its source: unaltered, breeding pets! We continue to offer a $10 off coupon on spay/neuter surgeries and work with our veterinarian partners to offer deserving families lower cost surgeries. We were extremely fortunate to have been awarded two spay/neuter grants; one from PetSmart Charities and one from Dogs Trust allowing us to spearhead a desperately needed county-wide low-cost spay/neuter program, which allowed us to alter 484 cats and 586 dogs in low-income households in Mobile County this year. Veterinarians have been overwhelmed these past two years, they have experienced staff shortages and in turn the available number of spay/neuter surgery slots has also plummeted. We will not be deterred and take a van load of cats and dogs to the spay/neuter clinic in Mississippi at least twice a month. These surgeries have prevented the birth of thousands of unwanted cats and dogs in Mobile County. We were awarded this generous grant from PetSmart Charities for three years in a row and, since they are drastically changing their grant model, it is highly doubtful that we will be awarded it again. Having said this, we know the demand for our Mobile SPCA-funded $10 off coupons will be staggering once again this year.   We cannot accomplish our life-saving work or continue our mission — to provide shelter, food, and medical care to the animals entrusted to us, promote adoptions and transport, assist with spay and neuter and educate people on responsible pet ownership — without your help. And this year we need you more than ever! We have been able to hold our semi-annual rummage sales but our two dinners – Spay-ghetti and Fish Fry – have been off the table. Hopefully we will be able to come together in March 2022 for a big plate of spaghetti and a lot of fun and music!   We receive no government funding, operating solely on donations, grants and fundraising. We are not a branch of the ASPCA, HSUS or any other national organization and receive no financial assistance from them for day-to-day expenses. If you can donate financially, please do; if you can donate your time, our staff would be very appreciative. And if you can find a place in your heart and home to adopt or foster a pet, their love and devotion will be worth more than words can describe.   Please donate today so we can continue to save even more lives next year. Your gift is tax deductible and will help us give our community’s homeless animals a start on a new life in a loving home. Thank you! Please know we sincerely appreciate your donation.The Mobile SPCA is a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) nonprofit charitable organization whose mission is to provide compassionate care, shelter, food, and medical attention to the animals entrusted to us while promoting adoptions, spay and neuter initiatives, responsible pet ownership and community education.Read more

title: raiden science foundation
Description: We are launching a GoFundMe campaign this holiday season to accelerate promising research & therapeutic development for UBA5. UBA5 is a rare progressive neurological genetic disorder. There have been less than 30 genetically confirmed and reported cases in the world. Life expectancy is unknown, and kids impacted can suffer from movement disability, cognitive impairment, and uncontrollable epilepsy. There are no effective treatments or cures currently for UBA5 disease.Our son, Raiden Pham, suffers from UBA5 disease. He is still young and slowly progressing cognitively. While Raiden is at high risk for seizures, they have not yet begun and so we are racing against time. If we can deliver gene therapy for Raiden soon enough, we may be able to reverse his disease trajectory and give him a better quality of life. We are not giving up on him. Read about Raiden’s Story and follow his journey on Instagram @Raiden_Journey.We founded the Raiden Science Foundation (“RSF”) to enable impactful research to help Raiden and other patients suffering from UBA5 disease. Visit our websiteOur MISSION is to harness to power of family, community, and science to accelerate development of UBA5 therapies. We are breaking down research barriers to advance gene therapy for UBA5. Raiden was diagnosed in August, and within 2 months, we established a partnership with UMass Chan Medical School to make this more than just a hope. The UMass team will be creating a gene replacement therapy program for UBA5 once we raise funds.Our VISION is to create a future where there are paths forward for treating rare diseases and empowering families to make a difference. Not only will our work lead to giving kids suffering from UBA5 disease a chance for a better quality of life, but we are also pushing forward medical innovation that can help millions suffering from rare diseases around the world. We are currently exploring additional research partnerships with St. Jude Children’s Hospital, Baylor College of Medicine, and Oregon Health & Science University. Read about our workThe only way Raiden and potentially other UBA5 patients can receive gene therapy within 3 years is to raise $1+ million to start the research program. Time keeps marching forward for Raiden, but it hasn’t yet started for UBA5 gene therapy development.Together, we can do this.Please donate if you can and/or share this campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues.No donations will be used for Raiden’s care or other personal use. Raiden Science Foundation is an Oregon nonprofit operating through a fiscal sponsorship with Rare Village Foundation, a Texas 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization. Donations to RSF are tax-deductible within the guidelines of U.S. law. Rare Village Foundation will manage the funds and ensure that they will go directly to Raiden Science Foundation to only accomplish our mission.Read more

title: restore tonga tsunami relief
Description: Bears Without Borders is organizing this fundraiser through our fiscal sponsor Menlo Atherton High School Football Association. Please help us restore Tonga… - It takes a village!Out in the Pacific Ocean near Fiji and Samoa is a beautiful archipelago made up of 169 islands that are the Kingdom of Tonga. On Saturday, Jan 15 an undersea volcano erupted, billowing tons of ash into the air and causing tsunami waves up to 49 feet in height. The ash and the tsunami hit the main island of Tongatapu and several smaller outer islands. These beautiful islands are now covered in thick blankets of ash, the air quality is unhealthy, and many structures have been destroyed. Some of the smaller islands have been completely destroyed - buildings, water, and agriculture. The main island has lost many structures, is scarce in clean drinking water, agriculture and most communications since the fiber optic cable has been damaged. It will take months and in some cases years to repair the damage to buildings and crops. It will take weeks to restore full communications, repair runways and docks so that our families and friends have clean drinking water, medical supplies and sufficient food. These islands will be beautiful once again in time… but right now, the Tongan people need our help to rebuild and restore their livelihoods. Tonga is not just a beautiful place, it has a beautiful culture. The people live simply and off of the land. Ofa (love), laughter, joy, community, and song fill the air. Tongans thrive on the richness of culture, family, and friends. They are warm, welcoming and generous. If you have encountered the large Polynesian (Tongan, Samoan and Fijian) community here in the Bay Area, you know first hand. Over the past 5 years, Bears Without Borders, which focuses on “Connecting Cultures Through Service and Relationships" in the Bay Area and abroad, has traveled with Menlo-Atherton students, alumni and staff to Tonga. In Tonga, the participants have worked with an elementary and middle school that needed major renovation from damages caused by Cyclone Gita in 2017. Throughout the program, an important cultural exchange takes place and deep friendships are formed. Throughout 2020-2021 we collected and shipped over 1,000 books for schools across the island. Tonga has impacted our lives in such a huge way, we are moved to pull together our resources to help the best we can.While we patiently wait for news from our friends, families and the young students with whom we are connected, we have set a goal to fund items that are most needed as identified by our team on the ground in Tonga when communication is restored. In the meantime, we are creating partnerships with organizations that we can support with funds to deliver water, medical supplies and food. We will continue to post updates from Tonga here and on our instagram site @bearswithoutborders.Bears Without Borders is fiscally sponsored by the M-A Football Association and every gift is tax deductible.Please share this post and join our local village in helping to provide much needed aid and assistance to our students who are so far away but who are always in our hearts here at home. On behalf of all of us at Bears Without Borders, Malo ‘aupito. Thank you.Read more

title: heal a new beginning for afghan refugees
Description: Thousands of Afghan refugees still awaiting their new homes are temporarily staying at military bases in the U.S. after the chaotic American evacuation at Kabul Airport this summer.A group of families is partnering with the HEAL foundation* to form a sponsor circle to bring some of these families to find a home in Wisconsin. Your donation will be used to provide housing, clothing, food, and the basic necessities of life for the first 90 days to help them get a new start in America. Please help these Afghan families find a new home! Hopefully this initial amount will allow the first of several families to find a home.One of the requirements for the sponsor circle is to raise $2,275 per person, so our goal is to raise enough money to support at least two families of five. Every little bit helps! Thank you for your support!*All donations are tax deductible through this partnership.More information about sponsor circles:https://www.state.gov/launch-of-the-sponsor-circle-program-for-afghans/https://www.sponsorcircles.org/More information about the HEAL foundation:https://thehealfoundation.org/Read more

title: saving corporal crunch
Description: Neglected and abandoned in a small Virginia town, Corporal Crunch was left to die. He and another dog were seized by animal control. Unfortunately, his companion did not make it and crossed over the rainbow bridge. Corporal Crunch was emotionally and physically broken with his chance of a healthy life slipping away with each minute.Old Dominion Humane Society (ODHS) stepped in to help. Coordinating their efforts in the early morning darkness, ODHS volunteers launched The Rescue of Corporal Crunch!Corporal Crunch’s trip to the Vet confirmed the severity of his condition. The Vet said that it was the worst case they had seen in awhile! So that just means we need to fight harder, raise more funding, and work with the best veterinarians to Save Corporal Crunch!The first step is to save Corporal Crunch’s Eyes!! We anticipate expenses between $8K - $10K for all treatments...plus all of the unexpected pop-up expenses that always happen, so we have set the goal at $15,000. Once treatment is complete, all remaining donations will be used to support other ODHS dogs, to include critical veterinary treatment!There are (3) ways to donate:Venmo: @OldDominionHumaneSocietyPlease note: CrunchGo Fund Me Charity: https://gofund.me/b41c10dfDog Krazy Donation: https://dogkrazy.com/This can be online in the form of food, eye wipes, joint supplements, or gift cards. Just tell them that it is for ODHS Crunch!Thank you for taking the time to read this and for opening your heart to Corporal Crunch!!!!! Maybe with good behavior, we can get him promoted to Sgt Crunch! Semper Fidelis and Thank You!Read more

title: 8s2nq9 lost everything
Description: Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit ELFA, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.On Friday, January 7, 2022, the Alkurdi family came home from having dinner with friends, devastated to find their life savings stolen from their home. The case is under investigation by the local police department.Immediately prior to the burglary, Marwa Alkurdi was in the process of planning a trip with the family, to visit her mother , who is due for open-heart surgery. With the burglary, they lost their social security cards, passports, $40,000 in cash savings, and another, estimated $30,000 in jewelry, not to mention the trauma of losing their sense of security and safety.This campaign is to try and help them recoup a little of the money they lost. At the very least, to allow the family an opportunity to visit Marwa’s mother before her surgery.Background: This young family, originally from Daraa, Syria arrived in Tucson, AZ five years ago, as Syrian refugees from Amman, Jordan. Issa & Marwa Alkurdi hit the ground running, motivated to build a new life through their hard work, for their 4 young daughters. They had left behind family, a home, and a small business—Issa was a shopkeeper who made a living selling fresh vegetables until the Syrian war. Like many others, he was arrested, tortured, and jailed for a few months. Upon his release, the family escaped on foot, and crossed the border into Amman, Jordan. After a few months at the refugee camp, Issa went into the city to find work. He worked odd jobs to survive. Finally, the family applied to the UN for refugee status and their journey brought them to Tucson, Arizona.This family’s work ethic, is what sets them apart. Eager to work and support his family, for the last five years, Issa has worked hard as a dishwasher in a local resort, and was very recently promoted to a chef position there. Marwa needed to stay at home to care for her 4 young children, and even though she struggles with ongoing health issues, she was motivated to find a way to make an income to help her husband, along with her family back home. She had lost 2 brothers in the war, and regularly sends money to support their orphans, along with supporting her mother.Marwa became an at-home baker through Elfa’s*, then-newly launched 	Syrian Sweet Exchange	 program. She worked hard selling her sweet confections through the program, travelling back-and-forth from Tucson to Phoenix, taking any opportunity to support her income. Even recently, she was one of few to volunteer to help support the newly arrived Afghans in Tucson, by catering their meals at highly discounted rates. Over the last 6 years, the family has struggled through many life altering challenges. One of them happened to be a blessing in disguise. Their identities were stolen for a period of three years, and along with that, their tax returns. Recently, the IRS sent them a check, back-paying 3 years’ worth of tax returns. They couldn’t believe this good fortune of unexpected savings of about $30,000. The husband and wife team had dreams of saving further for a down payment for a home—a way out of public housing. Even with this major setback, as is their proven work ethic, they will continue to fight forward for the sake of their family and their survival.*Elfa is a Tucson-based nonprofit organization providing refugees and youth of all backgrounds with resources, workshops, support, and a safe environment to develop healthy habits, find new talents, and gain leadership skills so that they may become independent and successful .Read more

title: TRB FeelREAL21
Description: THE COME BACK AND GIVE BACK TOUR: - FREE Collar & Leash Exchange + FREE Flu & Lepto Vaccination clinic on Dec 5th - here in LA.  - Spay & Neuter Clinics in Mexico, where we've happily helped fix over 250 Dogs & Cats...and counting.  - Silver Lake Adoption Sundays: where the public meets our Adoptable friends.  - #GivingTuesday where we all unite as a Community and donate to Orgs that work daily to make a DIFFERENCE. - DAILY DEDICATION: We humbly work EVERY DAY to Save Lives & Heal. We have several Project Dogs now, and increase the number of NEW Rescues during our year end Drive.A 2021 RECAP:ESPECIALLY DURING THIS DIFFICULT & CHALLENGING YEAR OF 2021 - we at The REAL Bark were HONORED to Rescue & Rehabilitate SO MANY Dogs, Cats, and even a Piglet, in desperate need of Life Saving Care, and offer them a deserved New Chance at a Loved Life. The REAL Bark is committed to continuing at Full Speed, and are thrilled to be participating in various Community Assistance programs over the holiday season, by way of our 'Come Back And Give Back Tour'.You likely have seen Captain Courage who suffered unbelievable abuse, and was confiscated by authorities, and brought back to Life with two life altering, necessary surgeries, extensive vetting, and dedicated nurturing.Who can forget the stunning Warrior Wynnie, who heartbreakingly was drug by a car and lost her back limbs? Wynnie is still in physical therapy, and having her back prosthetics fine-tuned, which allow her so much freedom of movement. She is simply the HAPPIEST, sweet girl, that could lead a seminar on Forgiveness.And we will never forget the horrific shape Hey Jude was found in - almost unrecognizable as a dog. Through major vetting and nurturing, Jude was 'brought back' and now living his best life as an adored, Adopted family member.These are but a few of the MANY countless new cases we worked DAILY on, in 2021. And like last year's year-end Fundraiser - where the amazing community came together and helped us raise funds via our GoFundMe Campaign - ALL OF THIS was made possible because of YOU.All of this happens through Community. And we are thrilled to give everything we have to help those in need. Sharing with others that are caring for their companions, or Rescuing and Vetting ALL falls within our desire to Give Back. And we ASK the support of Any & All Donations to keep going. Everything Counts and every penny goes directly to their Life Saving Care.Yes, we would rather not ask for donations, but as a very Independent & Thorough group, those donations make a GIANT difference in the Lives of MANY.We look so forward to being able to share the many new Success Stories of animals that did not stand a chance...and humbly ask you, to consider a donation to our Heartfelt Efforts.All Thanks to You.You are most appreciated, and celebrated, and a part of each Eye Twinkle & Tail Wag.In Deep Gratitude,The REAL Bark Team.Read more

title: provide registration forms for texas voters
Description: It is becoming very difficult for us to provide registration forms to new voters in Texas.The League of Women Voters of Houston provides at least 4,000 voter registration forms to new citizens at naturalization ceremonies each month. Additionally, hundreds of registration forms are distributed to eligible voters at local voter registration events hosted by LWV-H and community partners.In the past, the Secretary of State's Office provided these forms upon request to organizations across the state. Recent requests have been denied, and the deadline to register voters for the March 1st election is quickly approaching (January 31).Please help the League of Women Voters of Houston by donating funds to pay for printing costs.Immediate goal: 5,000 forms - $1,500 (expedited printing to provide forms for new eligible voters for the 3/1 election)Long term goal: 70,000 forms - $15,000 (printed forms for monthly naturalization ceremonies and voter registration events for the year 2022)The League of Women Voters of Houston is a nonpartisan nonprofit organization with no paid staff. These funds will go directly to voter registration efforts held by our dedicated volunteers. We truly appreciate your support as we continue working hard to register all eligible voters in our community!Read more

Since 2001, Water Mission has used innovative technology and engineering expertise to provide access to safe water for nearly 7 million people in 57 countries. To learn more, visit watermission.org. Water Mission's mission is to honor God by developing, implementing, and sharing best-in-class safe water solutions that transform as many lives as possible, as quickly as possible.Read more

title: honouring olivia keiko madalina bennett
Description: My name is Ella McDonald and I am starting this Go Fund Me for an important person in my life. Michael Bennett has been an integral person in my life for the past 9 years coaching and mentoring me at Cloverdale Black Belt Academy. He has also impacted the lives of many other students at the academy. During this time he was always more than just a coach, he was always someone I could go to when I needed anything. When you have known someone for nine years you grow a connection to them and they become more than what they were intended to be. Michael has never once given up on me or any of the other students but instead continued to push us to new heights.This past December Michael and his loving wife, Lina, welcomed their beautiful daughter, Olivia, to this world. What was supposed to be a joyful time in their life quickly turned to heartbreak. Olivia was promised a place in this world even though she would be in and out of the hospital her first few years. However, God had a different plan for her and she was given the best 9 days of her life surrounded by her loving family. The impact Michael has had on the whole Taekwondo community has left us all feeling the impact of this tragic loss. Even though many of us never had the privilege of meeting Olivia, she will always be remembered and loved by the Cloverdale Black Belt Academy family. During the time of Olivia’s birth the Bennett family spent eight days at Children’s Hospital and one day at Canuck Place, it was here where the Bennett family felt love and support from everyone working there. They helped the family deal with this great loss and made them feel loved. The hope of raising money in Olivia’s name is to give back to Canuck Place so they can continue to help families in the same way they helped the Bennett family during this hard time. This fundraiser has been set up to have all proceeds going directly to the Canuck Place. More information about Canuck Place Children's Hospice: Canuck Place is BC's pediatric palliative care provider for children with life-threatening illnesses and the families who love them. Our team of physicians, nurses, counsellors, therapists, staff and volunteers provide medical respite care, pain and symptom management, art, music and recreation therapy, end-of-life care, grief, loss and bereavement counselling-- all at no cost to families.Read more

title: help little dude with treatment s
Description: This little pup came to me after he was thrown down the stairs by a not very nice person. And of course I took him in and loved him. title: garrets promise at spirits promise
Description: As you know Garret passed away tragically on May 1st, 2021. Since then, we have been trying to figure out how we can allow his memory to live on forever. After researching different charities and considering a football scholarship in his honor, nothing felt quite right.Garret's passing has led us to a sanctuary of healing. Through group therapy, one on one counseling, volunteer work, and time at the farm, Spirit’s Promise has given us a second chance at life. We have smiled through times we only imagined would bring sadness, and found spiritual connections during times of utter despair. Spirit’s Promise has given us HOPE. We want to help give others a chance at restoring their lives the way Spirit’s Promise has been helping us to restore ours.When working with the family of Spirit's Promise, we realized there is a real opportunity to help, a real need that needs to be fulfilled. What has since developed is Garret's Promise. Garret's Promise is our commitment to the word promise. It's our promise to help autistic children, people in turmoil, people in grievance, and people who need hope. It's our promise to anyone who needs this promise in their lives, that we will be here to help them, and all in Garret's honor.Currently Spirit’s Promise operates strictly outdoors, limiting their scope of practice. Garret’s Promise, will bring an indoor round pen to the farm and will change the trajectory of how people experience Spirit’s Promise. This indoor sanctuary of healing will allow Spirit's Promise to help people no matter the time of year or the time of day. Rain or shine, day or night, Spirit’s Promise will be able to host community events, offer therapeutic programming, and bring love to those who feel unlovable.If you are so inclined, please help bring Garret's Promise to life. We hope you can become a part of our hope.Read more

title: santa save the sidebar
Description: Hey all, I need your help once again!I know it's right before Christmas, but we need your giving spirit and love of music to shine through right now. These last two years have been very hard on small venues like the Sidebar and not much relief was handed down from the legislation that was supposed to help. To keep Sidebar open and running, Feed The Scene Foundation Inc has been offered the opportunity to BUY THE SIDEBAR! Our plan is to have the non-profit purchase the business and the liquor license and run the bar as an open source non-profit so it will constantly endow itself for its own longevity. We would like to make a serious nod back to Mike Riley and his creation of the Charm City Art Space by making the Sidebar a place for everyone with a collective of promoters and other volunteers who care to help keep it running. All bartenders and staff will make livable wages and anything considered profit will be put back into the bar in terms of improvements or upgrades or guarantees for bands. No one on the Feed The Scene staff will be taking a salary from the bar. This is a labor of love.Now, you might be saying, "WAIT RACHEL HOW CAN I HELP?!?!?" HERE IS HOW!!! We need your donations. We are trying to raise $80,000 to cover the purchase, transfer of all legal property, liquor license, utilities, sound system, Etc ($50,000) and the remaining $30,000 is to cover a host of fixes the bar needs that may impede passing inspections we need for permits under new ownership. We will be keeping a public accounting of all funds that anyone can ask to see at any time. Anything raised over $80k will go to hopefully creating a usable greenroom on the lower level for bands and our drag shows. The best part is, because we are already a non-profit, all your donations are 100% tax deductible, so your giving helps you too!This whole endeavor is solely to make sure we don't lose the the only remaining small capacity, all-ages venue with a liquor license left in the city. This venue means so much to our local and national music community and we hope that even if you can't spare a dollar, that you can amplify the signal.Thank you so much,Rachel Taft, Kayleigh Lydick, Bobbie Dickerson, Bart Shiflett, Casey Severn, Nika Watkins, Jamie Schubert-Reitz and Feed The Scene Foundation Inc.Read more

title: money for freddie hughes
Description: FREDDIE HUGHESFreddie Hughes, one of the most gifted vocalists and great human beings, has unexpectedly passed away from Covid 19 on January 18, 2022. Freddie has been singing and recording since a young child and had a huge hit in the seventies entitled Send my Baby Back. Freddie grew up in Harbor Homes in West Oakland and is one of the last great soul singers left from the Bay Area and is well known internationally. His son Derick Hughes followed in his footsteps having recorded with Motown and Prince and toured extensively with Robert Flack filling in for the late great Donny Hathaway. Freddie & Derick are also featured performers on the Bay Area Jazz Society (BAJAZZS) & West Coast Blues Society co-sponsored CD called “The Sounds of Oakland” being released this February in the U.S.  Consequently,  BAJAZZS is asking for everyone’s help in raising money for Freddie’s burial and memorial because Freddie spent his lifetime performing for us and has no pension or available savings. We would love to be able to raise twenty thousand dollars in this effort. Please consider making a donation.Read more

title: mybs field and park improvements
Description: Hello MYBS families and fans,We hope your new year is off to a great start. As you know, we are always looking for ways to improve the baseball and softball playing experience for our kids and the fan experience for people like you. To that end, we have two exciting projects on deck for this year:·    Regrade, fix, and fill in the softball infields at Wheelock, improving the quality, safety, and playing experience for our kids.·    Replace the 70-year old bleachers at Metacomet. While these bleachers have a lot of character and Medfield baseball history, they are unsafe. As you've probably experienced, there are no handrails and the old wood is in desperate need of repair. We are extremely fortunate to have a very generous private donation of $15K to start the bleacher project, but it’s going to cost more to complete.We've set up a this page to support these two important projects. Any additional funds beyond what we need for these projects will be put toward future projects aimed at improving our player and fan experiences. Medfield Youth Baseball and Softball is a 501c3 non-profit (Tax ID: 04-3078229), so your donations are tax deductible. And don’t forget to use your company matching program, too!Donate $500+ and receive a free engraved brick at the Swain Concession Stand at Metacomet Park!·    Every $500+ donation will receive a 4x8 engraved brick·    Every $1,000+ donation will receive an 8x8 engraved brickIf you'd prefer to send a donation via check, our address is Medfield Youth Baseball & Softball, PO Box 366, Medfield, MA 02052.Thank you, in advance, for any support you can provide.Read more

title: halifax retales 10th anniversary
Description: 10 years, wow!In March of 2011, I had a serious break in my mental health and almost made a final decision, I'm glad I didn't make it. I was in denial. I didn't think "that" affected me, but I suffered from depression for years, as well as a couple of learning disabilities.I just kept my emotions bottled up and kept pushing them down.Then I broke!With some work, I could finally accept it was okay not to be okay!Part of my healing was to put positive ideas out there and connect with my community. I had always had a curiosity for what is opening and closing it was our small talk in a group of friends. I thought if we enjoy it maybe others will too.So, on January 16, 2012, I set up a Twitter account and tweeted "Welcome to Retail updates around the HRM" and Halifax ReTales was born. I was hoping to have 500 followers someday.It has been so rewarding. I have met so many fantastic people that make up the fabric of HRM.ReTales has grown so much a total following of over 125k across Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.I have been producing a weekly blog post every Sunday recapping the highlights of the week for nearly 7 years. As well as sending out in a weekly email. 3 years ago I also started writing a weekly column in The Chronicle Herald as well.It has always remained freeand now...here is my askIf you value Halifax ReTales and the decade of work I have put in to get people engaged in HRM or made your life a little more fun, helping you discover something that you now consider a favourite.I ask you to help others find comfort in their mental health and say thank you to me by donating to the Mental Health Foundation Of Nova Scotia.Thanks for being part of my journey, and thanks Halifax for being such a great inspiration.Love ArthurMore information about the Mental Health Foundation Of Nova Scotia: The Mental Health Foundation of Nova Scotia is a registered charity that aims to increase financial support to community initiatives throughout Nova Scotia while providing hope and eradicating the stigma surrounding mental illness and addiction. Our mission is to make a difference in the lives of Nova Scotians by supporting mental health and addiction initiatives. Our vision is a future where Nova Scotians living with mental illness and addiction are thriving in our communities.This fundraiser will end Jan 21, 2022Read more

title: a dip a day in december 2021
Description: Hi , my name is Mark Elliott and I will be taking on the challenge of A Dip A Day In December 2021. Every day in December, Hail, Rain or snow I will be getting into the chilly waters around Sligo and Leitrim in just a pair of shorts and a swim hat. I won't be doing this alone as there will be someone with me each day and people are welcome to come along as we take the plunge at local beaches and lakes. Each day we will log our progress, sharing via social media our time spent in the water, the temperature of the water and photos of all those taking part. You can follow us on Facebook and Instagram by logging on to A Dip A Day In December 2021.The aim of this event is to create much needed funds and awareness for the tremendous North West STOP Suicide Prevention. Suicide has unfortunately become far too common in our society and this organisation are at forefront in providing support to those in need of counselling almost immediately.In the first 6 months of 2021 North West STOP have funded 630 counselling sessions to those seeking help. With counsellors available in Sligo, Leitrim, Mayo, West Cavan, Donegal, Roscommon and Longford they are committed to putting clients in touch with counsellors as fast as possible and FREE OF CHARGE!!!Many of their clients have attempted to seek help elsewhere and have either been placed on long waiting lists or have not have their needs met.Counselling is provided to those who are feeling suicidal or have been bereaved by suicide.So PLEASE support this event in whatever way possible.Thank youRead more

title: help to save the windward zero waste hui
Description: The Windward Zero Waste School Hui is a living system that educates students about sustainability at Ka’ohao, Ka’elepulu, Kainalu and Enchanted Lake Elementary schools as well as Kailua Intermediate School. Using hot compost and green waste piles, worms and cardboard and paper management, the Hui has reduced school trash by over 90%. In fact, 57.8 TONS of waste has been diverted from Oahu landfills in 2021, so far. Check out Zero Waste School Hui for stats on food recovery, composting and vermicomposting. Mindy and the team publish daily!This award-winning, nationally-acclaimed zero waste program, a partnership of Windward Oahu schools working cooperatively in the pursuit of waste reduction, soil restoration, and applied environmental education is at risk of shutting down due to a shortage of funding. Our fundraising goal to sustain the program through the end of the 2021-2022 school year is $50,000, which will be used to support the trained staff members who manage all organic processing daily, and educate the next generation ofenvironmental leaders.Over 2,000 students participate every school day, contributing food waste to composting systems which turn the material into rich, organic compost, which is sold to the community with all income going back to participating schools to fund sustainability and education programs.If you would like to donate, please click the Donate Now button, or the donate button at Zero Waste - Donate : this directs donations to O’ahu Resource Conservation and Development Council.If you have a special set of skills or time you’d like to donate to the program, please contact us.The Windward Zero Waste School Hui initiative is a non-profit program of the Oahu ResourceConservation and Development Council , a 501(c)(3) organization. EIN 94-3279682Read more

title: support hindu scholars understanding hinduphobia
Description: Understanding Hinduphobia is an initiative to develop greater public consciousness about Hinduphobia, particularly in the West. Developing scholarship and research that rigorously dissects prevailing Hinduphobic commentary and establishes a greater understanding of the Hindu American experience is vital. This is a first-of-its-kind effort, and we urge you to join us. Consider donating towards this historic initiative.Understanding Hinduphobia 2021 was a landmark event. It was the first time that scholars, activists, students, and allies convened to explore Hinduphobia with the depth, rigor, and cross-disciplinary examination that the phenomenon demands. UH 2021 was the first time the Hindu community created a multi-disciplinary academic space to inform the general public about Hinduphobia. Nearly a thousand people registered for the online conference from across the globe.This year, Understanding Hinduphobia will have two platforms - a public, HSC-hosted web-based conference and a smaller, in-person closed gathering of scholars where we will share our research, collaborate, build community, and inspire.Understanding Hinduphobia 2022 Scholar Conference connects senior and emergent scholars to start building our collective, our sangha. We are all committed to laying the foundation stones for this area of research within the Academy. We are motivated by our commitment to clear the obstacles preventing authentic, diverse expressions of Dharma in the academy and ensuring that the work that examines Hinduphobia is rigorous and meets high academic standards.All of us are deeply committed to our scholarship, which is neither rewarded nor sufficiently recognized by the Academy. In fact, we do this work often at great peril to our career security. It can be draining and isolating. That’s why UH 2022 will convene at a retreat center nestled in nature, allowing us to restore our prana, connect with each other, and be with Bhumi Mata.Understanding Hinduphobia is for all of us. We turn to our community for support, to help nurture this space and build a different path for our community and for our children.Please consider donating.If you would like to donate using another method, please visit https://www.hindustudentscouncil.org/donateNote: Hindu Students Council is a Section 501(c)3 charitable organization, EIN 47-3523535. All donations are deemed tax-deductible absent any limitations on deductibility applicable to a particular taxpayer. No goods or services were provided in exchange for your contribution. Please note that HSC and the Understanding Hindu initiative are dedicated to their mission and vision. The views and affiliations of donors do not influence or represent either HSC or the UH initiative.Read more

title: snn9e help rusty
Description: RUSTY NEEDS YOUR HELP.This morning we were contacted by Sian from Krazy Kats Kitty Rescue who had taken this boy into the vets for neutering today. Once there the vets quickly realised he had a blocked bladder and the estimated cost of treatment is around £1500. Krazy Kats Kitty did not have the funds and asked us to help again. As this is a medical emergency we couldnt refuse as the alternative is Rusty was euthanized. His potassium levels are sky high and he is at high risk of cardiac arrest but our vets are doing everything possible.The cost of his treatment was money we had allocated for our second hand cattery rebuild coming this weekend but animals lives must always come first.If you can help by donating any amount we and Rusty will truly appreciate it.Read more

title: dr kenneth oconnor scholarship fund
Description: Donations to this fund will establish a scholarship to honor the life of Dr. Kenneth O’Connor, who was a professor of chemistry at Marshall University. Dr. O’Connor generously shared his love of science and chemistry with his students at Marshall and with the greater Huntington-Charleston community through his efforts in chemistry magic shows and scout merit badge workshops. Dr. O’Connor was known for his varied collection of chemical demonstrations, which intrigued and inspired many to pursue careers in science and medicine. He regularly donated an enormous amount of his personal time to meet one-on-one with his students in class or with those who wanted career advice in preparation for medical school. Dr. O’Connor was a greatly respected professor, colleague, and friend who possessed a unique ability to make organic chemistry unintimidating and fun. We seek to remember and continue his great legacy through the establishment of this scholarship fund.Read more
